page.title: 14Employment in Middleton
page.content: There are 117 registered on the current electoral roll and a total population of 150. On average there is 1 death per year. Most people work within a 6 mile radius of the village. A few travel daily to Derby, Sheffield and Nottingham. One works in Saudi Arabia. Apart from farmers and members of their families only 2 males are employed full time on the land. Several work in nearby Quarries and Brickworks although recession in the fluorspar trade has caused some unemployment. In the 1981 census of 115 people over 16, 69 were active economically, 1 was sick and 1 out of work. Those working away from the area are employed in public service, mining engineering, a University and shops. Two people worked on Government created job schemes.
